tit.cmt: 擬洋風建築→→Gi-yofu architecture (imitative Western-style architecture)[定訳不明]

sen.j: 擬洋風建築（ぎようふうけんちく）とは、欧米の建築を日本の職人が見よう見まねで建てたもの。
sen.e: "Gi-yofu architecture" was an architectural style that Japanese carpenters created by imitating Western-style architecture.
"Gi-yofu architecture" is an architectural style that Japanese carpenters created by imitating Western-style architecture.
"Gi-yofu architecture" is an architectural style that Japanese carpenters created by imitating Western-style architecture.

sen.j: 主に明治初期に各地で建造された（一部、大正頃のものにも擬洋風的な要素を持つ建造物もある）。
sen.e: Examples of it were built across the country mainly in the early Meiji Period (some buildings built in Taisho Period had elements of this style).
Examples of this style could be found across the country mainly in the early Meiji Period (also some buildings built in the Taisho Period have elements of this style).
sen.cmt: 「of it were built」→「of this style could be found」「the」挿入, 「had」→「have」
sen.e: Examples of this style could be found across the country mainly in the early Meiji period (also some buildings built in the Taisho period have elements of this style).
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 日本の建築史を物語るものとして、重要文化財に指定あるいは登録有形文化財に登録されているものも多い。
sen.e: Many of them are designated as Important Cultural Properties or Registered Tangible Cultural Properties to provide evidence of Japanese architectural history.
Many of them are designated as Important Cultural Properties or Registered Tangible Cultural Properties in order to provide evidence of Japanese architectural history.
Many of them are designated as Important Cultural Properties or Registered Tangible Cultural Properties in order to provide evidence of Japanese architectural history.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 幕末の開港以降、外国人旧居留地には彼等が本国の建築様式を持ち込んだ建造物が続々と建てられた。
sen.e: Expatriates from Western countries have built many buildings in the style of their home countries in foreign settlements in Japan since the opening of ports in Bakumatsu (in the late Edo Period).
Expatriates from Western countries built many buildings in the style of their home countries in the foreign settlements in Japan after the opening of ports in the Bakumatsu (in the late Edo Period).
Expatriates from Western countries built many buildings in the style of their home countries in the foreign settlements in Japan after the opening of ports in the Bakumatsu (in the late Edo period).
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: やがて居留地の建築に刺激を受けた大工の棟梁が、見よう見まねで洋風デザインの要素を取り入れた建物を築くようになった。
sen.e: In due course, Japanese master carpenters, inspired by those buildings in the foreign settlements, began to construct buildings that employed some of Western-style designs by simulating them.
In due course, Japanese master carpenters, inspired by those buildings, began to construct buildings that employed some Western-style designs.
In due course, Japanese master carpenters, inspired by those buildings, began to construct buildings that employed some Western-style designs.

sen.j: これが擬洋風建築で、文明開化の象徴ともされた。
sen.e: Thus Gi-yofu architecture was born, and it was considered a symbol of the civilization and enlightenment.
Thus Gi-yofu architecture was born, and it was considered a symbol of civilization and enlightenment.
Thus Gi-yofu architecture was born, and it was considered a symbol of civilization and enlightenment.

sen.j: 主に民間或いは地方の建築で多く見られる。
sen.e: Many of them are privately built or in local cities.
Many of them are private buildings or in local areas.
sen.cmt: This sentence is a little vague - it would perhaps be better if 地方の建築 was more precise. 「privately built」→「private buildings」, 「cities」→「areas」
sen.e: Many of them are private buildings or in local areas.

sen.j: これは当時の県令（現在の都道府県知事に警察・検察・教育長等の権限を統合したような治権首長）あるいは篤志家の命令あるいは出資により、特に地方都市でみられた「第２の文明開化」といっても過言ではない時流であり役所、学校施設校舎、病院などに数多く用いられた。
sen.e: It was in the booming period that could be called 'the second civilization and enlightenment' when local kenrei (a local head of a government that held authorities equivalent to the integrated powers of governors, police, prosecutors, and school superintendents) or rich benefactors ordered or invested in plans to build administrative buildings, school facilities, and hospitals employing many kinds of Western-style designs.

It was in the period that could be called 'the second civilization and enlightenment' when local kenrei (local heads of government that held authorities equivalent to the integrated powers of governors, police, prosecutors, and school superintendents) or rich benefactors ordered or invested in plans to build administrative buildings, school facilities, and hospitals employing many kinds of Western-style designs.
sen.cmt: 「booming」削除, 「a local head of a government」→「local heads of government」
sen.e: It was in the period that could be called 'the second civilization and enlightenment' when local kenrei (local heads of government that held authorities equivalent to the integrated powers of governors, police, prosecutors, and school superintendents) or rich benefactors ordered or invested in plans to build administrative buildings, school facilities, and hospitals employing many kinds of Western-style designs.

sen.j: これらは近代化の象徴として、地元民の誇りともなった。
sen.e: Local people were proud of them as the symbol of Japan's modernization.
Local people were proud of them as they symbolized Japan's modernization.
Local people were proud of them as they symbolized Japan's modernization.

sen.j: 本来の役割を終えた後も、民俗資料館等として保存・活用されていることがある。
sen.e: Some of them are preserved or used as folk historical libraries after they ended their original functions.
Some of them are preserved or used as folk historical libraries after their original functions ended.
sen.cmt: 「they ended their original functions」→「their original functions ended」
sen.e: Some of them are preserved or used as folk historical libraries after their original functions ended.

sen.j: 初期の代表的なものとして、二代目清水喜助（清水建設の実質的創始者）による築地ホテル館（現存しない）がある。
sen.e: A typical example in the early stage of this style was Tsukiji Hotel (now defunct) built by second Kisuke SHIMIZU (founder of Shimizu Corporation).
A typical example in the early stage of this style was Tsukiji Hotel (now defunct) built by the second Kisuke SHIMIZU (founder of Shimizu Corporation).
A typical example in the early stage of this style was Tsukiji Hotel (now defunct) built by the second Kisuke SHIMIZU (founder of Shimizu Corporation).

sen.j: これは幕府の要請を受けて築地居留地の外国人旅館として建設が始まり、明治維新後に完成した。
sen.e: Its construction started by the request of Tokugawa Shogunate as a hotel for foreigners in Tsukiji Settlement, and completed after the Meiji Restoration.
Its construction started at the request of the Tokugawa Shogunate for a hotel for foreigners in Tsukiji Settlement, and was completed after the Meiji Restoration.
Its construction started at the request of the Tokugawa Shogunate for a hotel for foreigners in Tsukiji Settlement, and was completed after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 現存する擬洋風建築の中でも有名なものは開智学校（松本市）である。
sen.e: Kaiichi-gakko School (Matsumoto City) is one of the most famous existing examples of Gi-yofu architecture.
Kaiichi-gakko School (in Matsumoto City) is one of the most famous existing examples of Gi-yofu architecture.
Kaichi School (in Matsumoto City) is one of the most famous existing examples of Gi-yofu architecture.

sen.j: 左右対称の外観で中央に塔屋を造り、正面入口の上には、竜や天使の彫刻が舞っているという、何とも不思議なデザインである。
sen.e: It has a symmetric appearance with a tower house at the center, and reliefs of dragons and angels above the front entrance; a peculiar design.
It has a symmetrical appearance with a tower house at the center, and reliefs of dragons and angels above the front entrance; a peculiar design.
It has a symmetrical appearance with a tower house at the center, and reliefs of dragons and angels above the front entrance; a peculiar design.

sen.j: これを建てた地元の棟梁・立石清重は、東京や横浜に出かけて洋風建築を見て学び、自分なりに消化して奔放な造形を行った。
sen.e: Seiju TATEISHI, a local master builder who built this structure, visited Tokyo and Yokohama to learn Western-style buildings by observing them, and he studied the techniques in his own way to create its bold figures.

Seiju TATEISHI, a local master builder who built this structure, visited Tokyo and Yokohama to learn about Western-style buildings by observing them, and he studied the techniques in his own way to recreate their bold designs.
sen.cmt: 「about」挿入, 「create its bold figures」→「recreate their bold designs」
sen.e: Seiju TATEISHI, a local master builder who built this structure, visited Tokyo and Yokohama to learn about Western-style buildings by observing them, and he studied the techniques in his own way to recreate their bold designs.

sen.j: 特色
sen.e: Features
Features
Features

sen.j: 擬洋風建築は外観に洋風デザインを採りいれているが、小屋組などの基礎構造は和風建築の技術が用いられている。
sen.e: Gi-yofu architecture outwardly employed Western-style designs but used traditional Japanese techniques in the basic structures such as in roof frameworks.
Gi-yofu architecture outwardly employed Western-style designs but used traditional Japanese techniques in the basic structures such as in roof frameworks.
Gi-yofu architecture outwardly employed Western-style designs but used traditional Japanese techniques in the basic structures such as in roof frameworks.

sen.j: 外観の具体例としては下見板や、小さくした窓に窓上飾りをつけたり、塔やバルコニーを備えたりする。
sen.e: Examples of the outward forms are: weather-boards, window decorations above small windows, towers, and balconies.
Examples of the outward forms are: weather-boards, window decorations above small windows, towers, and balconies.
Examples of the outward forms are: weather-boards, window decorations above small windows, towers, and balconies.

sen.j: いわゆる異人館は擬洋風建築とは区別される。
sen.e: So called "Ijinkan" (former residences of early foreign settlers) are different from buildings of Gi-yofu architecture.
So called "Ijinkan" (former residences of early foreign settlers) are different from buildings of Gi-yofu architecture.
So called "Ijinkan" (former residences of early foreign settlers) are different from buildings of Gi-yofu architecture.

sen.j: また例えば浜寺公園駅駅舎は、建築家、辰野金吾の設計によるもので、このような正規の建築教育を受けた建築家や技師の建てたものは擬洋風建築とは言わない。
sen.e: Buildings designed or built by officially educated architects or engineers, such as the building of Hamaderakoen Station designed by architect Kingo TATSUNO, are not called Gi-yofu architecture.
Buildings designed or built by officially educated architects or engineers, such as the building of Hamaderakoen Station designed by architect Kingo TATSUNO, are also not called Gi-yofu architecture.
Buildings designed or built by officially educated architects or engineers, such as the building of Hamaderakoen Station designed by architect Kingo TATSUNO, are also not called Gi-yofu architecture.

sen.j: 擬洋風建築という言葉は昭和になってから建築史家が使い始め、近年定着してきた言葉である。
sen.e: Architecture historians began to use the term "Gi-yofu architecture" in Showa Period, and it has been commonly used only recently.
Architecture historians began to use the term "Gi-yofu architecture" in the Showa Period, but it has been commonly used only recently.
Architecture historians began to use the term "Gi-yofu architecture" in the Showa period, but it has been commonly used only recently.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 当初は、西洋建築の正しい知識を持たない職人が造った奇妙な建築と見られてきたが、第二次世界大戦後の明治建築再評価の中で、次第に高く評価されるようになってきた。
sen.e: Although it was initially considered strange architecture made by carpenters of no knowledge of authentic Western architectural techniques, it has gradually been highly regarded in the movement of re-evaluation of Meiji architecture since the end of the Second World War.

Although it was initially considered strange architecture made by carpenters with no knowledge of authentic Western architectural techniques, it has gradually become highly regarded within the re-evaluation of Meiji architecture since the end of the Second World War.

Although it was initially considered strange architecture made by carpenters with no knowledge of authentic Western architectural techniques, it has gradually become highly regarded within the re-evaluation of Meiji architecture since the end of the Second World War.

sen.j: しかし、「洋風」という言葉が既に「西欧のような」という意味を含んでおり、その上に「擬」という語を重ねるのは適切でないとして、「明治初期洋風建築」という用語を提唱する建築史家もいる。
sen.e: Some architecture historians propose to use the term 'Maiji Shoki Yofu Kenchiku' (Western-style architecture in the early Meiji Period), saying 'yofu' means 'Western-style' and adding 'gi ' (quasi- or pseudo-) is inappropriate.

Some architecture historians propose to use the term 'Meiji Shoki Yofu Kenchiku' (Western-style architecture in the early Meiji Period), saying 'yofu' means 'Western-style' and adding 'gi ' (quasi- or pseudo-) is inappropriate.

Some architecture historians propose to use the term 'Meiji Shoki Yofu Kenchiku' (Western-style architecture in the early Meiji period), saying 'yofu' means 'Western-style' and adding 'gi ' (quasi- or pseudo-) is inappropriate.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 森鴎外の用法に擬西洋造（まがいせいようづくり）とあるが、言葉の指す範囲は上記の説明とは一致していない。
sen.e: Novelist Ogai MORI used 'Magai-seiyo-zukuri' (擬西洋造) (quasi-Western structure), but his definition of the term was different from that mentioned above.
Novelist Ogai MORI used 'Magai-seiyo-zukuri' (擬西洋造) (a quasi-Western structure), but his definition of the term was different from that mentioned above.
Novelist Ogai MORI used 'Magai-seiyo-zukuri' (擬西洋造) (a quasi-Western structure), but his definition of the term was different from that mentioned above.

sen.j: 擬洋風建築の例
sen.e: Examples of Gi-yofu architecture
Examples of Gi-yofu architecture
Examples of Gi-yofu architecture

sen.e: Note: 'Important Cultural Property' means this item is designated as Important Cultural Property by the nation (Japanese Government) in accordance with the Law for Protection of Cultural Properties.
